intro: Sabulina regeliana, commonly known as the Regel's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant typically grows in alpine or subalpine habitats, where it adapts to cold and arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of high-altitude ecosystems.
